Variables

ZO_ERROR zoUartError
 Error buffer used to store errors occuring during function or ISR execution.

Detailed Description

Overview
The zoUart library implements a set of functions for manipulation of the USART0 AVR peripheral. Whether you are going to use RS232 simple 5V uart or half duplex RS485 the functions needed for uart communications are contained in this library.
Usage example 
 #include "zoUart.h"

 int main(void)
 {
     //initialize the AVR USART0 peripheral to 115200 Kbps, 
     //8 data bits, No parity, 1 stop bit
     zoUartInit();                  
 
     //say hello world to a terminal on your PC!
     zoUartPutString("Hello world\n\r");

 }
Todo:
Expand this library to multi uart processors like the Mega640 etc.

Define Documentation

#define ZO_UART_ERROR_MEMORY_ALLOCATION_ERROR   0x01

When attempting to initialize the Uart there wasn't enough available memory. This means that memory of the AVR processor is used up. To resolve this problem: Optimize user code for memory consumption or use an AVR with more RAM memory :)

#define ZO_UART_ERROR_RX_FRAME_ERROR   0x02

The received uart frame had some error: ie more or less data bits than configured, more or less stop-bits than configured, frame was never completed and so on. To resolve this error first double-check the uart settings of the device you are communicating. Then check cabling. Then try a reduction of baud rate.

#define ZO_UART_ERROR_RX_PARITY_ERROR   0x03

The received frame had invalid parity. To resolve this error follow the same procedure described for the frame error.

#define ZO_UART_ERROR_RX_BUFFER_OVERFLOW   0x04

The receive buffer has overflowed. This means that the device connected to our AVR sends data faster than user code can handle. To resolve this error call zoUartGetChar() more often or reduce the baud rate of both the AVR and the connected device.

#define ZO_UART_ERROR_RX_DATA_OVERRUN   0x05

The hardware receive register of the AVR processor has been overwritten, ie new data came in from the uart before the ISR implemented in the zoUart.c file had the time to read the receive register. This means that there is not enough ISR time. To resolve this error try optimizing the user ISRs for speed or even shutting down some of them.

#define ZO_UART_ERROR_TX_TIMEOUT   0x06

The software has waited more than the Transmit TimeOut for a space in the transmit buffer. This is not a serious error since it is only natural for an AVR, running at several MHz, to put bytes in a buffer much faster than the uart peripheral can send them. After all the uart is sending bytes with a rate of some kilo-BITS per second...

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum ZO_UART_PARITY

Uart parity configuration enumeration. Select one of the enumeration values as an argument to the zoUartSetParity() function.

Enumerator:
ZO_UART_PARITY_NONE 

configure no parity

ZO_UART_PARITY_ODD 

configure odd parity

ZO_UART_PARITY_EVEN 

configure even parity

enum ZO_UART_DATA_BITS

Uart data-bits configuration enumeration. Select one of the enumeration values as an argument to the zoUartSetDataBits() function.

Enumerator:
ZO_UART_DATA_BITS_5 

configure 5 data bits

ZO_UART_DATA_BITS_6 

configure 6 data bits

ZO_UART_DATA_BITS_7 

configure 7 data bits

ZO_UART_DATA_BITS_8 

configure 8 data bits

ZO_UART_DATA_BITS_9 

configure 9 data bits

enum ZO_UART_STOP_BITS

Uart stop-bits configuration enumeration. Select one of the enumeration values as an argument to the zoUartSetStopBits() function.

Enumerator:
ZO_UART_STOP_BITS_1 

configure 1 stop bit

ZO_UART_STOP_BITS_2 

configure 2 stop bits

Function Documentation

bool zoUartInit ( void   ) 

Initializes the USART0 peripheral, byte storage etc. Always call this function prior to any other in this library file.

Returns:
True if the memory initialization for uart was successfull
bool zoUartSetBaud ( u32  baudRate  ) 

Sets the uart baud rate in bits per second.

Parameters:
baudRate Baud rate in Bps.
Returns:
True if the baud rate can be achieved by the USART0 peripheral.

void zoUartSetTransmitTimeOut ( u16  miliseconds  )  [inline]

Configures the time that the MCU waits for a space in the transmit buffer.

Parameters:
miliseconds Time to wait in miliseconds. Maximum value is 65535.
bool zoUartSetBuffersSize ( u08  size  )  [inline]

Configures the size of the transmit and the receive buffers.

Parameters:
size The size of each buffer in bytes.
void zoUartInitRs485 ( volatile u08 *  port,
u08  pinConnectedToReDe 
)

Configure the port and pin connected to the RE/DE pin of a half-duplex RS485 onboard trancseiver (if one is used). For example if the RE/DE pin of such a device is connected on PORTD, PD2 then initialize its use like this: 

 zoUartInitRs485(&PORTD,PD2);
Parameters:
*port pointer to AVR port connected to the RS485 RE/DE pin.
pinConnectedToReDe the specific pin of the port.
bool zoUartPutChar ( const u08  c  ) 

Sends a byte over uart. The byte is first put in the transmit buffer. The uart transmit ISR handles the actual transmission of the byte.

Parameters:
c The byte to send over uart.
Returns:
False if the MCU waited more than the Transmit Timeout to put the byte in the transmit buffer.
bool zoUartGetChar ( u08 *  byte  ) 

Receives a byte over uart. The byte is taken from the receive buffer. The uart receive ISR handles incoming data and puts them in the receive buffer.Usage example: 

    u08 c;
    while(!zoUartGetChar(&c))
        zoUartPutChar(c);

The above code waits until a byte is received through uart. When it is it transmits it back to the secder.

Parameters:
*byte Pointer to the byte that was received.
Returns:
False if the receive buffer was empty (ie no data received at this function call) or if there was a reception error.
bool zoUartPutString ( const char *  buffer  ) 

Sends a string over uart. The string must be terminated with a null.

Parameters:
*buffer Pointer to the string to be sent.
Returns:
False if the MCU timed out on waiting for a space in the transmit buffer.
bool zoUartPutData ( const u08 *  buffer,
u08  length 
)

Sends a byte buffer over uart.

Parameters:
*buffer Pointer to the byte buffer to be sent.
length The number of bytes to send.
Returns:
False if the MCU timed out on waiting for a space in the transmit buffer.
bool zoUartTxBufferIsFull ( void   )  [inline]

Checks if the transmit buffer is full.

Returns:
True if the uart transmit buffer is full, false if it isn't.
bool zoUartRxBufferIsEmpty ( void   )  [inline]

Checks if the receive buffer is empty.

Returns:
True if the uart receive buffer is empty, false if it isn't.
